subject: Education
title: The Banking Model of Education
description: A quick, practical guide to The Banking Model of Education.

hook.text: Freire compared traditional teaching to banking: teachers deposit facts into empty student accounts.

buildup.text: In the banking model, teachers narrate and students memorize. Knowledge flows one way only.

discovery.text: Freire's alternativeâ€”problem-posing educationâ€”treats students as co-investigators of their own reality.

twist.text: The banking model persists because it's efficient to measure and easy to control at scale.

climax.text: Problem-posing education is messier, slower, and harder to testâ€”but it produces real thinkers.

punchline.text: A mind is not a bank account. You can't just deposit knowledge.

quiz.question: What is Freire's 'banking model' of education?
options: Teachers deposit information into passive students who memorize without questioning
Schools that teach financial literacy and economic skills
A model where students earn credits like currency
